title: OpenAI Launches Free ChatGPT Go Access in India - Here’s Everything You Need to Know
description: OpenAI has announced free access to ChatGPT Go for users in India, allowing millions to experience AI-powered conversations without a paid subscription. ChatGPT Go is a lighter, faster version of ChatGPT, offering quick responses and easy access for everyday tasks. The feature is now available on both the ChatGPT website and mobile app, supporting multiple languages. This move highlights OpenAI’s effort to make artificial intelligence more accessible to students, professionals, and general users across India.
content:
1
OpenAI has announced that it will offer ChatGPT Go free for one year to all users in India starting November 4, 2025. This offer coincides with OpenAI’s first DevDay Exchange event in Bengaluru, highlighting India’s importance as a key market.

title: Amazon to lay off 14,000 corporate employees
description: Amazon told employees on Tuesday that it’s cutting 14,000 corporate jobs as it invests billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.
content:
Amazon told employees on Tuesday that it’s cutting 14,000 corporate jobs as it invests billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.

title: Amazon's Bold AI Bet: 14,000 Job Cuts to Streamline Future
description: Amazon is cutting around 14,000 corporate jobs to bolster its investment in artificial intelligence. This strategic move aims to reduce bureaucracy and better allocate resources to address key customer needs. Teams affected by the layoffs will receive notifications soon.
content:
Amazon has announced a significant reduction of about 14,000 corporate positions as part of its strategy to enhance spending on artificial intelligence initiatives.
The decision marks a continued effort by Amazon to streamline operations by reducing ... [310 chars]

title: Qatar finance minister says AI to be big part of US investments, UK-Gulf trade deal close
description: Qatar's finance minister said on Tuesday that artificial intelligence would be a big part of planned Qatari investments in the United States.
content:
RIYADH, Oct 28 (Reuters) - Qatar's finance minister said on Tuesday that artificial intelligence would be a big part of planned Qatari investments in the United States.
